{{also|gast|gäst}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|gast}}, from {{inh|de|goh|gast}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|guest}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ɡast]}} * {{audio|de|De-Gast.ogg|Audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Gast.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Gastes|gen2=Gasts|Gäste}} # [[guest]] ====Usage notes==== ''Gast'' is one of the few German masculine nouns referring to human beings that has no feminine equivalent. ''Gast'' is used for both male and female guests. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|(e)s|pl=Gäste}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4 |de|Badegast |Fahrgast |Gastarbeiter |Gästezimmer |gastfrei |gastfreundlich |Gastfreundlichkeit |Gastfreundschaft |Gastgeber |Gasthaus |Gasthof |gastlich |Gastmahl |Gaststätte |Hotelgast }}
